text: (1:18) Solomon ordered a temple to be built to honor the Lord, as well as a royal palace for himself.
(2:1) Solomon had 70,000 common laborers and 80,000 stonecutters in the hills, in addition to 3,600 supervisors.
Solomon sent a message to King Huram of Tyre: “Help me as you did my father David, when you sent him cedar logs for the construction of his palace.

Look, I am ready to build a temple to honor the Lord my God and to dedicate it to him in order to burn fragrant incense before him, to set out the bread that is regularly displayed, and to offer burnt sacrifices each morning and evening, and on Sabbaths, new moon festivals, and at other times appointed by the Lord our God. This is something Israel must do on a permanent basis.

<st data-num="0834 0589">I</st> will <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st> a <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> our <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> is <st data-num="01419" class="">greater</st> than <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>.

Of course, who can really build a temple for him, since the sky and the highest heavens cannot contain him? Who am I that I should build him a temple! It will really be only a place to offer sacrifices before him.

“Now send me a man who is skilled in working with gold, silver, bronze, and iron, as well as purple-, crimson-, and blue-colored fabrics, and who knows how to engrave. He will work with my skilled craftsmen here in Jerusalem and Judah, whom my father David provided.

<st data-num="07971" class="">Send</st> me <st data-num="0730" class="">cedars</st>, <st data-num="01265" class="">evergreens</st>, and <st data-num="0418" class="">algum</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06086" class="">trees</st> from <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="03045 0834">know</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> are <st data-num="03045" class="">adept</st><n id="2" /> at <st data-num="03772" class="">cutting down</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">trees</st> in <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st>. My <st data-num="02009 05650">servants</st> will work <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>

to <st data-num="03559" class="">supply</st> me with <st data-num="07230" class="">large quantities</st> of <st data-num="06086" class="">timber</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0834 0589">I</st> am <st data-num="01129" class="">building</st> a <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st>, <st data-num="06381" class="">magnificent</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.
Look, I will pay your servants who cut the timber 20,000 cors of ground wheat, 20,000 cors of barley, 120,000 gallons of wine, and 120,000 gallons of olive oil.”
King Huram of Tyre sent this letter to Solomon: “Because the Lord loves his people, he has made you their king.”

Huram also said, “Worthy of praise is the Lord God of Israel, who made the sky and the earth! He has given King David a wise son who has discernment and insight and will build a temple for the Lord, as well as a royal palace for himself.

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> I am <st data-num="07971" class="">sending</st> you <st data-num="02361" class="">Huram</st> <st data-num="01" class="">Abi</st>,<n id="1" /> a <st data-num="02450" class="">skilled</st> and <st data-num="03045 0998">capable</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st>,

<st data-num="01121" class="">whose</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">mother</st> is a <st data-num="04480 01323 01835">Danite</st> and whose <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> is a <st data-num="0376 06876">Tyrian</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="03045" class="">knows</st> how to <st data-num="06213" class="">work</st> with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>, <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st>, <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>, and <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st>, as well as <st data-num="0713" class="">purple</st>, <st data-num="08504" class="">blue</st>, <st data-num="0948" class="">white</st>, and <st data-num="03758" class="">crimson</st> <st data-num="0713 08504 0948 03758">fabrics</st>. He knows how to <st data-num="06605" class="">do</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all kinds of</st> <st data-num="06603" class="">engraving</st> and <st data-num="02803" class="">understands</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="04284 0834">design</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> to him. He will work <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> your <st data-num="02450" class="">skilled craftsmen</st> and the <st data-num="02450" class="">skilled craftsmen</st> of my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>.

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> let my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> to his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> the <st data-num="02406" class="">wheat</st>, <st data-num="08184" class="">barley</st>, <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>, and <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st> he has <st data-num="0834 0559">promised</st>;
we will get all the timber you need from Lebanon and bring it in raft-like bundles by sea to Joppa. You can then haul it on up to Jerusalem.”
Solomon took a census of all the male resident foreigners in the land of Israel, after the census his father David had taken. There were 153,600 in all.
He designated 70,000 as common laborers, 80,000 as stonecutters in the hills, and 3,600 as supervisors to make sure the people completed the work.
